result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jacob Frances French

records.addlTxt:
9:35 AM CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, Attorney Karl Anderson in court for State of Wisconsin, Defendant Jacob Frances French appeared by video. Court reviews file. DA Anderson questions DE regarding community service status for amendment. DE states that community service has been completed. DA Anderson requests verification of community service and a stipulation will be filed to amended ordinance. Court sets 30-day internal review.  Adjourned: 9:40 AM. kma
Review scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 07:45 am.
Misdemeanor and Criminal Traffic Scheduling Order. Signed by SJN on 7/22/2022.c: DA and Atty via e-file. km
Pre-trial/scheduling conference on October 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

$500 bond on file.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

2:00 PM  CO: SJN, RPR: Deiss, Clerk: Lindabaur. ADA: Erica Ellenwood with Student Intern Connor Smith  DF ATTY:  Stephanie Schmidt for today Defendant Jacob Frances French in court.  ADA Ellenwood updates the Court regarding potential resolution and requests bond. Defendant does not qualify for PD. DE declines PFAC. Court advises of charges and possible penalties. Waive reading. Court enters NG plea and reserves on pre-plea rights. Bond argument. Court orders bond. Court sets PSC, but will not set SETC. Adjourned at 2:03 PM.  gll
Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial/scheduling conference on October 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
